item.description:
Noon-2PM. The Basic Doubles Skills Clinic is entry level in a series of free Boston Volleyball Meetup doubles clinics for beginners through advanced players. This is your chance to learn doubles!

We ran this clinic on 4/14 and 4/21 and they went very well, but space was limited, so we couldn't take everyone that wanted in. Here's your chance.

The Basic Doubles Skills Clinic is designed for players who have played some form of organized volleyball but are relatively new to the doubles scene. We assume that you are already able to serve a ball inbounds at least 75% of the time. We focus only on the basic skills listed below. After practicing these basic skills, you should be able to compete well at B level in local grass doubles tournaments.

The other clinics in this series cover the Low Intermediate through Advanced skills.

The format of clinics are 65% drills, 20% instruction, and 15% scrimmage. Each clinic is two hours long. We run these outdoors on good-weather days only.

Coach Matt has been playing doubles for 20 years. He competes at AA level. He has learned volleyball coaching in the HITS and FullSpeed programs. Matt co-runs Meetup QK Doubles Tournaments with Brian Lee.

These clinics have limited spots available and are offered on multiple dates. Please sign up as an individual. If you wish to bring a guest, please have them register in meetup and sign themselves up. Meetup and this clinic are free. Even if the event is full, do sign up to the waitlist, as there is a good chance you'll get in. If you need to cancel, please do so at least 18 hours in advance, but better late than never. It is not good to no-show. No-shows will be moved to the waitlist for future clinics.

Please arrive on time or 15 minutes early. It is optional but would be appreciated if you show up 30 minutes early to help coach set up nets.

What you should bring:

• Outdoor shoes with nubby tread.

• Your outdoor volleyball. We prefer Spaulding King of the Beach or Wilson Official AVP. Please do not bring indoor volleyballs. Coach will bring extra volleyballs but they will be old.

• Water. There is no source of water near the site.


SKILLS LIST

Basic Skills (B level)

1. Serving

2. Body Position and Footwork

3. Bump Passing

4. Bump Setting

5. Roll Shot

 

Low Intermediate (BB level)

1. Overhand Digging

2. Poking

3. Cut Roll Shot

4. Three-meter hitting (mainly for men).

 

Intermediate Skills (A level)

1. Reading

2. Diving

3. Overhand Setting

4. Downward Spiking

 

Advanced Skills (AA level)

1. Blocking

2. Jump Serving

3. Beach Digging

4. Tooling
item.how_to_find_us: Between Soldiers Field Road and the River, near the kayak rental hut. Parking is free.
item.name: Basic Volleyball Doubles Skills Clinic
